wait.description: wait for this function, whether it is asynchronous or not

target.description:
execution target

you can select target to execute puppeteer function, default browser > page > frame
but if frame.id is not equals to page.mainFrame().id , the frame's priority is big than page

plugin.description:
- js module path of plugin
- function of plugin

parser.description:
- js module path of parser
- function of parser

anyOf.description:
function type of parser

The parser can be used to parse an action.

you can also use plugin to do that, but this is not necessary if the action dose not involve the content of the page.

priority.description:
priority of parser.

the priority of{@linkArrayParser}is 100

frame.description:
use the index to specify the frame.

parser:{@linkFrameParser}

page.description:
use the index to specify the page.

parser:{@linkPageParser}

include.description: include value in page or frame

match.description: match value in page or frame

evaluate.description:
call the function of{@linkPage.evaluate}or{@linkFrame.evaluate}.

if return true, then execute the child actions{@linkSwitchCase.actions}

url.description: url sub string of page or frame

cookie.description: cookie string of page or frame

LaunchOptions.description: Generic launch options that can be passed when launching any browser.

executablePath.description:
Path to a browser executable to use instead of the bundled Chromium. Note
that Puppeteer is only guaranteed to work with the bundled Chromium, so use
this setting at your own risk.

ignoreDefaultArgs.description:
If `true`, do not use `puppeteer.defaultArgs()` when creating a browser. If
an array is provided, these args will be filtered out. Use this with care -
you probably want the default arguments Puppeteer uses.

timeout.description:
Maximum time in milliseconds to wait for the browser to start.
Pass `0` to disable the timeout.

dumpio.description:
If true, pipes the browser process stdout and stderr to `process.stdout`
and `process.stderr`.

env.description: Specify environment variables that will be visible to the browser.

pipe.description: Connect to a browser over a pipe instead of a WebSocket.

extraPrefsFirefox.description: {@linkhttps ://searchfox.org/mozilla-release/source/modules/libpref/init/all.js | Additional preferences}that can be passed when launching with Firefox.

waitForInitialPage.description:
Whether to wait for the initial page to be ready.
Useful when a user explicitly disables that (e.g. `--no-startup-window` for Chrome).

BrowserLaunchArgumentOptions.description: Launcher options that only apply to Chrome.

headless.description: Whether to run the browser in headless mode.

userDataDir.description: Path to a user data directory.{@linkhttps ://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main/docs/user_data_dir.md | see the Chromium docs}for more info.

devtools.description:
Whether to auto-open a DevTools panel for each tab. If this is set to
`true`, then `headless` will be forced to `false`.

args.description: Additional command line arguments to pass to the browser instance.

BrowserConnectOptions.description:
Generic browser options that can be passed when launching any browser or when
connecting to an existing browser instance.

ignoreHTTPSErrors.description: Whether to ignore HTTPS errors during navigation.

defaultViewport.description: Sets the viewport for each page.

slowMo.description:
Slows down Puppeteer operations by the specified amount of milliseconds to
aid debugging.

targetFilter.description: Callback to decide if Puppeteer should connect to a given target or not.

Viewport.description: Sets the viewport of the page.

deviceScaleFactor.description:
Specify device scale factor.
See{@linkhttps ://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Window/devicePixelRatio | devicePixelRatio}for more info.

isMobile.description: Whether the `meta viewport` tag is taken into account.

isLandscape.description: Specifies if the viewport is in landscape mode.

hasTouch.description: Specify if the viewport supports touch events.
